data.6: Have you not seen what your Lord did to the ´Ad
data.7: Of Eram with lofty pillars (erected as signposts in the desert),

data.13: So your Lord poured a scourge of punishment over them.
data.14: Your Lord is certainly in wait.
data.15: As for man, whenever his Lord tries him and then is gracious and provides good things for him, he says: "My Lord has been gracious to me."
data.16: But when He tries him by restraining his means, he says: "My Lord despises me."
data.17: No. In fact you are not generous to the orphans,
data.18: Nor do you urge one another to feed the poor,
data.20: And love wealth with all your heart.
data.21: Surely when We pound the earth to powder grounded, pounded to dust,
data.22: And comes your Lord, and angels row on row,
data.23: And Hell is brought near, that day will man remember, but of what avail will then remembering be?
data.24: He will say: "Alas the woe! Would that I had sent ahead something in my life."
data.25: None can punish as He will punish on that day,
data.26: And none can bind as He will bind.
data.28: Return to your Lord, well-pleased and well-pleasing Him.
